Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Detected incompatible device type for this ESC EEPROM.

CauseRemedy.Cause: You might have updated the ESC EEPROM with the wrong Identity.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Perform an EEPROM Update with the Systemmanager.

Event.Message: Read failure EEPROM. Pcb ID {0}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Impossible to read Data from the Identity EEPROM of a Pcb. (no Response) - ID 0: ControlPcb - ID 1: FrontPcb - ID 2: AdditionalAxisPcb - ID 3: DisplayPcb - ID 6: SafetyPcb - ID 7: CpuPcb

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal hardware error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Send the AX8000 to the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Unsupported Pcb type. Pcb ID {0}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Detected unsupported Pcb: - ID 0: ControlPcb - ID 1: FrontPcb - ID 2: AdditionalAxisPcb - ID 3: DisplayPcb - ID 6: SafetyPcb - ID 7: CpuPcb

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Pcb is not supported by this firmware.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the Beckhoff Homepage for a newer Firmware.

Event.Message: Persistent data seems to be corrupted. (0x{0,x})

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The content of the persistent data memory seems to be corrupted.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal hardware error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Send the AX8000 to the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Internal Software Error Type A, Additional Errorcode 0x{0,x}

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Fatal Software Error.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Fatal Software Exception Error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please switch the 24 V supply off and on again. If this happens again, contact the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Internal Software Error Type B, Additional Errorcode 0x{0,x}

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Fatal Software Error.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Fatal Software Exception Error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please switch the 24 V supply off and on again. If this happens again, contact the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Internal Software Error Type C, Additional Errorcode 0x{0,x}

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Fatal Software Error.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Fatal Software Exception Error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please switch the 24 V supply off and on again. If this happens again, contact the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Init Timeout, Slotnumber {0}

CauseRemedy.Cause: The initialization process of this slot was working for a very long time.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the Parameters of this module and try again.

Event.Message: Illegal Slotconfiguration. Slot {0} is empty.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A Slot which should contain a Module must be empty.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please select a legal Module for this Slot.

Event.Message: Illegal Slotconfiguration. Double Feedback Selection.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A Feedback Module, which is only possible one time per Axis was selected as primary and secondary Encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please select another Feedback as primary or secondary Encoder.

Event.Message: Illegal Slotconfiguration. Slot {0} has to be empty.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A Slot which should be empty contains a Module.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please remove the Module from this Slot.

Event.Message: Illegal Slotconfiguration. Slot {0} contains unsupported ModuleIdent 0x{1,x}.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A Slot contains an unsupported ModuleIdent.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please select a legal Module for this Slot.

Event.Message: Module in slot {0}: Transition Pre-Op to Safe-Op (ECat) not successful (hr=0x{1,X})

CauseRemedy.Cause: The module in the mentioned slot reports during the ECat-Transition Safe-Op to Op an error.

Event.Message: Module in slot {0}: Transition Safe-Op to Op (ECat) not successful (hr=0x{1,X})

CauseRemedy.Cause: The module in the mentioned slot reports during the ECat-Transition Safe-Op to Op an error.

Event.Message: Module in slot {0}: Transition Op to Safe-Op (ECat) not successful (hr=0x{1,X})

CauseRemedy.Cause: The module in the mentioned slot reports during the ECat-Transition Safe-Op to Op an error.

Event.Message: Module in slot {0}: Transition Safe-Op to Pre-Op (ECat) not successful (hr=0x{1,X})

CauseRemedy.Cause: The module in the mentioned slot reports during the ECat-Transition Safe-Op to Op an error.

Event.Message: Illegal Slotconfiguration. The selected feedback combination is not supported.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The some of the configured types of feedback are not supported at the same time.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the feedback configuration of all axes of this device.

Event.Message: System restart or sync lost

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Slave has received no ProcessData for more than one EtherCAT Cycle.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the realtime Tasks of your EtherCAT Master.

Event.Message: Lost Distributed clocks Sync

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Software Sync PLL has left it's locked State.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check your EtherCAT Sync0 configuration.

Event.Message: Invalid sync out unit configuration. Actual value is 0x{0,x} and has to be 0x{1,x}.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Invalid sync out unit configuration
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check your EtherCAT Master configuration.

Event.Message: Transition Pre-Op to Safe-Op not successful. Sync Manager {0} Length Error. Requested Length=0x{1,x} is not between Min=0x{2,x} and Max=0x{3,x}

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Parameters of the CoE Communication Objects do not fit the Sync Manager Parameters.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, if you are working with the right EtherCAT Device Description XML-File.

Event.Message: Transition Pre-Op to Safe-Op not successful. Sync Manager {0} Address Error. Requested Address=0x{1,x} is not between Min=0x{2,x} and Max=0x{3,x}

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Parameters of the CoE Communication Objects do not fit the Sync Manager Parameters.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, if you are working with the right EtherCAT Device Description XML-File.

Event.Message: Transition Pre-Op to Safe-Op not successful. Sync Manager {0} Settings Error. 0x{1,x}

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Parameters of the CoE Communication Objects do not fit the Sync Manager Parameters.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, if you are working with the right EtherCAT Device Description XML-File.

Event.Message: Transition Pre-Op to Safe-Op not successful. Sync Manager {0} Address Range 0x{1,x}..0x{2,x} overlaps Sync Manager {3} Address Range 0x{4,x}..0x{5,x}

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Parameters of the CoE Communication Objects do not fit the Sync Manager Parameters.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, if you are working with the right EtherCAT Device Description XML-File.

Event.Message: Sync Manager {0} is disabled. Sync Manager Size {1} and the Calculated Size {2} shall be zero.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Parameters of the CoE Communication Objects do not fit the Sync Manager Parameters.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, if you are working with the right EtherCAT Device Description XML-File.

Event.Message: Sync Manager {0} Address 0x{1,x} is not multiple of 4.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Sync Manager Startaddress is not a multiple of 4.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Configure the Startaddress to a multiple of 4. (32 Bit Alignment)

Event.Message: Dynamic Sync Manager {0} Address 0x{1,x} is not multiple of 4.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Sync Manager Startaddress is not a multiple of 4.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Configure the Startaddress to a multiple of 4. (32 Bit Alignment)

Event.Message: Dynamic Sync Manager {0} Address Range 0x{1,x}..0x{2,x} overlaps Sync Manager {3} Address Range 0x{4,x}..0x{5,x}

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Parameters of the CoE Communication Objects do not fit the Sync Manager Parameters.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, if you are working with the right EtherCAT Device Description XML-File.

Event.Message: Dynamic Sync Manager {0} Settings Error. 0x{1,x}

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Parameters of the CoE Communication Objects do not fit the Sync Manager Parameters.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, if you are working with the right EtherCAT Device Description XML-File.

Event.Message: Dynamic Sync Manager {0} Address Error. Requested Address=0x{1,x} is not between Min=0x{2,x} and Max=0x{3,x}

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Parameters of the CoE Communication Objects do not fit the Sync Manager Parameters.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, if you are working with the right EtherCAT Device Description XML-File.

Event.Message: Dynamic Sync Manager {0} Length Error. Requested Length=0x{1,x} is not between Min=0x{2,x} and Max=0x{3,x}

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Parameters of the CoE Communication Objects do not fit the Sync Manager Parameters.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, if you are working with the right EtherCAT Device Description XML-File.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The complete access write to this parameter failed.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please write your values with single access.

Event.Message: Pdo Mapping Error: Unable to map Object 0x{0,x}/{1,x}.(not possible) (SyncManager {2})

CauseRemedy.Cause: A mapping Parameter is not supported of this Device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, your mapping Configuration.

Event.Message: Pdo Mapping Error: Double Mapping of Object 0x{0,x}/{1,x} (SyncManager {2})

CauseRemedy.Cause: A mapping Parameter is not supported of this Device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, your mapping Configuration.

Event.Message: Pdo Mapping Error: Unable to map Object 0x{0,x}/{1,x}.(no Mappings left) (SyncManager {2})

CauseRemedy.Cause: A mapping Parameter is not supported of this Device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, your mapping Configuration.

Event.Message: Pdo Mapping Error: Object 0x{0,x}/{1,x} has to be mapped always.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The Object has to be mapped always.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An object, which must be in the mapping is not mapped.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please add a mapping to the mentioned object.

Event.Message: Pdo Mapping Error: Object 0x{0,x}/{1,x} has to be mapped for modes of operation {2}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Your actual requested Modes of Operation requires the mentioned Object in the Mapping.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A mapping Parameter is not supported of this Device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, your mapping Configuration.

Event.Message: Pdo BitMapping Error: Object 0x{0,x}/{1,x} is not next to Object 0x{2,x}/{3,x}. (SyncManager {4})

CauseRemedy.Cause: A mapping Parameter is not supported of this Device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, your mapping Configuration.

Event.Message: Pdo BitMapping Error: Can not Transform Bit-Mappings to Byte-Mappings. (SyncManager {0})

CauseRemedy.Cause: A mapping Parameter is not supported of this Device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, your mapping Configuration.

Event.Message: Pdo Mapping Error: Invalid Oversampling Factor ({0}) Object 0x{1,x}/{2,x} (SyncManager {3}).

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The oversampling factor of the mentioned Object is not possible.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Number of samples is higher than the Sync1/Sync0 ratio.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, your mapping Configuration.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Sync1/Sync0 ratio divided through the number of samples is not integer.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, your mapping Configuration.

Event.Message: Pdo Mapping Error: Oversampling is not allowed for Object 0x{0,x}/{1,x} (SyncManager {2}).

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Oversampling is not allowed for the mentioned Object.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mapping parameters contain oversampling for an object which doesn't support oversampling.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check, your mapping Configuration.

Event.Message: Pdo Assignment Error: Assignment 0x{0,x}{1,x} contains a Pdo 0x{2,x} which doesn't exist.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The Pdo Assignment List contains a Pdo which doesn't exist.

CauseRemedy.Cause: You might have used a Debug XML-Description in your actual Project.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please refresh your XML-Description and insert a new Instance of this Device in your Project.

Event.Message: Safe-Op is not possible because the local TwinCAT Runtime is in ConfigMode.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: You should only see this Message, if you are a AX Developer.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The internal TwinCAT Runtime is in ConfigMode.

Event.Message: Transition Pre-Op to Safe-Op not successful. Safetycard not detected.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal hardware error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Send the AX8000 to the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: EtherCAT Slave Stack Error: Al Status Code 0x{0,x}
Debug firmware, replace "As soon as possible"!

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Debug firmware: Replace ASAP!

Event.Message: Dbg: {0}

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: internal use only

Event.Message: Internal Error, Additional Errorcode 0x{0,x}

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Internal Error

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the power supply module from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: DC link overvoltage

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: DC link overvoltage because the brake power of the power supply module is too low.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Parameterization of the brake chopper from the power supply module is wrong.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the parameterization of the brake chopper from the power supply module.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Wrong selection of the brake resistor from the power supply module.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the resistance of the brake resistor. Check the power of the brake resistor.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The brake resistor from the power supply module is defective
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Measure the current resistance of the brake resistor.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Fan speed seems to be zero.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Fan speed seems to be zero.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The velocity signal of the cooling fan is zero.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the cooling fan.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Supply undervoltage: supply +24V

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Supply undervoltage: supply +24V

CauseRemedy.Cause: The 24V Supply Voltage went under 18V.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check your power supply.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Power supply controlword, torque off order

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The power supply device is in an error state and sent a torque off order to the connected Axes.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Something went wrong in the power supply device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the messages of the power supply device.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Power supply controlword, live counter inactive

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The power supply device controlword contains a live counter which didn't increment for the maximum accepted timespan.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Power supply status is not alive.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please Check if the Power supply status is linked to the Supply Device and the Device is in EtherCAT OP state.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Power supply controlword, NC handling order

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The power supply device is in an error state and sent a NC handling order to the connected Axes.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Something went wrong in the power supply device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the messages of the power supply device.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Power supply controlword, non-regenerative brake order

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The power supply device is in an error state and sent a non-regenerative brake order to the connected Axes.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Something went wrong in the power supply device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the messages of the power supply device.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Power supply controlword, regenerative brake order

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The power supply device is in an error state and sent a regenerative brake order to the connected Axes.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Something went wrong in the power supply device.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the messages of the power supply device.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Supply overvoltage: supply +24V

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Supply overvoltage: supply +24V

CauseRemedy.Cause: The 24V Supply Voltage went over 40V.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check your 24V supply voltage.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Parameter error in Object 0x{0,x}/{1,x}

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The mentioned parameter contains a not accepted value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Something is wrong with the parameters in this object.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the parameters of the mentioned object.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Sync Controller: Configured Sync1 Cycle Time ({0} ns) is above Maximum ({1} ns).

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The configured Sync1 Cycle Time is above the maximum.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Cycle Time of your NC-Task is above the supported maximum value of this drive.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please set your Task to a shorter Cycle Time.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Sync Controller: Configured Sync1 Cycle Time ({0} ns) is below Minimum ({1} ns).

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The configured Sync1 Cycle Time is below the minimum.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Cycle Time of your NC-Task is below the supported minimum value of this drive.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please set your Task to a longer Cycle Time.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Sync Controller: Configured Sync1 Cycle Time ({0} ns) is not a multiple of the Sync0 Cycle Time ({1} ns).

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The configured Sync1 Cycle Time is not a multiple of the Sync0 Cycle Time.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Cycle Time of your NC-Task has to be a multiple of the drives Sync0 Cycle Time.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please set your Task to a valid Cycle Time.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Sync Controller: Configured Sync0 Cycle Time ({0} ns) is unequal {1} ns.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The configured Sync1 Cycle Time is not the default Cycle Time.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the power supply module from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Pdo Mapping Error: Object 0x{0,x}/{1,x} has to be mapped always.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The Object has to be mapped always.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An object, which must be in the mapping is not mapped.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please add a mapping to the mentioned object.

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Dbg: {0}

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: internal use only

Event.Message: Device, DeviceMainSlot: Internal Error, Additional Errorcode 0x{0,x}

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Internal Error

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the power supply module from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: No Error

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: This Message is thrown always, if the Device enters an error-free state.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An Axis entered the error free state.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Short circuit (motor-side)

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The drive hardware detected an over-current on the motor phases. The short circuit detection was triggered.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor cable.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor cable

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor winding.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor winding with an high voltage test or check the winding resistance.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Continuous over current (device output side) Phase U

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The drive software detected an overcurrent on the motor phases U.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor cable.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor cable

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor winding.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor winding with an high voltage test or check the winding resistance.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Continuous over current (device output side) Phase V

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The drive software detected an overcurrent on the motor phases V.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor cable.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor cable

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor winding.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor winding with an high voltage test or check the winding resistance.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Continuous over current (device output side) Phase W

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The drive software detected an overcurrent on the motor phases W.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor cable.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor cable

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor winding.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor winding with an high voltage test or check the winding resistance.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Phase U current offset out of range

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The measured current offset of Phase U is outside the accepted range.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the power supply module from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Phase V current offset out of range

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The measured current offset of Phase V is outside the accepted range.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the power supply module from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Phase W current offset out of range

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The measured current offset of Phase W is outside the accepted range.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the power supply module from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Motor brake current offset out of range

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The measured current offset of the motor brake is outside the accepted range.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the power supply module from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support that is responsible for you.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The device might be influenced by an external magnetic field.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the environment of this device for magnetic components.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Phase failure motor

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The drive software detected an phase failure at the motor side. Please check wiring.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A power wire is not connected properly to the hybrid motor connector.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the power connections to the hybrid motor connector.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A power wire in the motor cable is broken.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the power wires in the motor cable.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The hybrid motor connector seems not to be plugged in properly.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check if the hybrid motor connector is plugged in properly.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: DC link under-voltage

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: An under-voltage occurred in the DC link circuit.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The DC link voltage level was under the configured minimum.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the minimum DC link voltage parameter. (Object 0x2C02/1)

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: DC link is not ready

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Axis got an enable command before DC link was ready.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check your power supply device.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Drive overtemperature shut down

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The drive temperature has reached a critical value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The ambient temperature is too high
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Cool down the ambient temperature

CauseRemedy.Cause: Internal brake power and power loss of axis are too high
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Lower the brake power and power loss of axis

CauseRemedy.Cause: The fan is defective
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the fan

CauseRemedy.Cause: The cooling slots or the measuring sensors are polluted
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Clean the cooling slots and the measuring sensors

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Output stage STO active.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The Axis is unable to operate, because the Amplifier is locked from the safety module. (Safe Torque Off / STO)

CauseRemedy.Cause: The amplifier is locked by the safety module.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the status of the safety module.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Supply DC link circuit is not ready

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Power supply device is not ready.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please Check the Messages and the Status of the Supply Device.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Power supply communication is not established

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Power supply status is not alive.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please Check if the Power supply controlword of this Axis Device is linked to the Power Supply Device and the Device is in EtherCAT OP.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Power supply SDO communications are not finished.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please Check if the Power supply communication parameters and status of DeviceMain.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Positive limit switch active

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Positive limit switch reached

CauseRemedy.Cause: The axis has been moved to the positive limit switch.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please move the axis away from the positive limit switch.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Negative limit switch active

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: Negative limit switch reached

CauseRemedy.Cause: The axis has been moved to the negative limit switch.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please move the axis away from the negative limit switch.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Loss of the hardware enable

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The configured hardware enable input has been deactivated by an external event, even though the AX8000 was under control.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Problems with the digital inputs
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the digital inputs

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Loss of the hardware enable (Reaction TorqueOff)

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The configured hardware enable input has been deactivated by an external event, even though the AX8000 was under control.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Problems with the digital inputs
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the digital inputs

CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please move the axis away from the positive limit switch.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Negative limit switch active

Detail.Name: Description

CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please move the axis away from the negative limit switch.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Modulo remainder will not be stored.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Persistent memory is not present.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Persistent data seems to be corrupted. (0x{0,x})

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The content of the persistent data memory seems to be corrupted.

CauseRemedy.Cause: There is an internal hardware error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Send the AX8000 to the Beckhoff branch office that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Internal Watchdog Error

CauseRemedy.Cause: Too many objects in the PDO-mapping.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the number of objects in the PDO-mapping.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the power supply module from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: The Axis seems not to be parameterized.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Object 'AxisMain parameters/Configured drive type' was not set.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Write your drive type into 'AxisMain parameters/Configured drive type'.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Factor Group Parameters: Feed constant illegal feed

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The feed constant - feed contains an illegal value (Object 0x6092/1 ChA or 0x6892/1 ChB).
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please use a 2^{x} value (x from 16 to 28) for rotary encoders and a 10^{x} value (x from 0 to 9) for linear encoders.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Factor Group Parameters: Feed constant illegal shaft revolutions

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The feed constant - shaft revolutions contains an illegal value (Object 0x6092/2 ChA or 0x6892/2 ChB).
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please set value to '1'.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Factor Group Parameters: Gear ratio illegal Motor shaft revolutions

Detail.Name: Description

CauseRemedy.Cause: The gear ratio - motor shaft revolutions contains an illegal value (Object 0x6091/1 ChA or 0x6891/1 ChB).
CauseRemedy.Remedy: You might add the default value here.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The additional position encoder resolution - encoder increments contains an illegal value (Object 0x60E6/1 ChA or 0x68E6/1 ChB).

Detail.Name: Description

CauseRemedy.Cause: The additional position encoder resolution - motor revolutions contains an illegal value (Object 0x60EB/1 ChA or 0x68EB/1 ChB).
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please compare it to your encoder values.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Velocity factor illegal. A possible Value would be {0}/{1}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The velocity factor (Object 0x6096 ChA or 0x6896 ChB) does not adjust the velocity scaling to 0.1 mRPM in case of rotary Motors and 0.1 um/s in case of linear encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please change your setting to the suggested value.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Acceleration factor illegal. A possible Value would be {0}/{1}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The acceleration factor (Object 0x6097 ChA or 0x6897 ChB) does not adjust the velocity scaling to 1 degree/s^{2} in case of rotary Motors and 1 um/s^{2} in case of linear encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please change your setting to the suggested value.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Scaling index object 0x{0,x} does not fit the Factor group parameters for the first Encoder

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mentioned scaling index object doesn't represent the factor group settings of the first encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please compare the selected scaling to your factor group settings.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Scaling index object 0x{0,x} does not fit the Factor group parameters for the second Encoder

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mentioned scaling index object doesn't represent the factor group settings of the second encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please compare the selected scaling to your additional factor group settings.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Motor or Primary Feedback changed
Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Secondary Feedback changed
Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Offset position actual value: No position offset existing in source 'encoder memory'

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: There is no primary position offset stored, for the selected source 'encoder memory'.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A position offset should used in the position control loop, but no position offset has been saved.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Calibrate the axis and save the new position offset.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Offset additional position actual value: No position offset existing in source 'encoder memory'

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: There is no secondary position offset stored, for the selected source 'encoder memory'.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A position offset should used in the position control loop, but no position offset has been saved.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Calibrate the axis and save the new position offset.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Offset position actual value: No position offset existing in source 'drive memory'

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: There is no primary position offset stored, for the selected source 'drive memory'.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A position offset should used in the position control loop, but no position offset has been saved.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Calibrate the axis and save the new position offset.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Offset additional position actual value: No position offset existing in source 'drive memory'

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: There is no secondary position offset stored, for the selected source 'drive memory'.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A position offset should used in the position control loop, but no position offset has been saved.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Calibrate the axis and save the new position offset.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Jerk factor illegal. A possible Value would be {0}/{1}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The jerk factor (Object 0x60A2 ChA or 0x68A2 ChB) does not adjust the velocity scaling to 100 degree/s^{2} in case of rotary Motors and 100 um/s^{2} in case of linear encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please change your setting to the suggested value.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: The range {0} of the Position range limit is below the minimum accepted value of {1}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The range of the Position range limit (Object 0x6096 ChA or 0x6896 ChB) is below the minimum accepted value. The Range is calculated 'max limit' - 'min limit' + 1 and has to be positive.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The range of the Position range limit (Object 0x6096 ChA or 0x6896 ChB) is below the minimum accepted value. The Range is calculated 'max limit' - 'min limit' + 1 and has to be positive.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the min and max value of the position range limit.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Position range limit Inc with remainder is not supported for primary feedback.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The position range limit is scaled internally to encoder increments. This calculation result contains a remainder, which is not supported for the primary feedback.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The position range limit is scaled internally to encoder increments. This calculation result contains a remainder, which is not supported for the primary feedback.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the position range limit and the factor group parameters of this feedback.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Position range limit Inc with remainder is not supported for secondary feedback.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The position range limit is scaled internally to encoder increments. This calculation result contains a remainder, which is not supported for the secondary feedback.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The position range limit is scaled internally to encoder increments. This calculation result contains a remainder, which is not supported for the secondary feedback.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the position range limit and the factor group parameters of this feedback.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Object 0x{0,X}/{1,X} changed in EtherCAT SafeOP or OP.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: This errormessage was created, because this change during Runtime is potentially dangerous, if you don't know what you do.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The value of the position range limit or a Factor group object was changed in EtherCAT SafeOP or OP.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Execute fault reset command.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Motor brake: Current monitoring error.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The motor brake current monitoring detected an insufficient current.

CauseRemedy.Cause: You have configured a motor brake and the motor brake current fell below the motor brake current monitoring level.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check your motor brake connection (wires and connectors). Check the parameter 'motor brake current monitoring level' Object 0x3000/5 (Ch A) or Object 0x3400/5 (Ch B).

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Current sensor motor phase U

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Disconnect the power supply module from the mains (including the 24 V power supply) and start a new attempt. If this error occurs repeatedly, please call the Beckhoff support that is responsible for you.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Current sensor motor phase V

CauseRemedy.Cause: An unknown hard- or software error has occurred.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: EtherCAT Statemachine shutdown with enabled Axis

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The EtherCAT Statemachine received a shutdown command, while the Axis was enabled.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The EtherCAT Statemachine received a shutdown command, while the Axis was enabled.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please disable your Axes before Restart or Shutdown your EtherCAT Master.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Controlword output cycle counter monitoring

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The output cycle counter of the controlword didn't increment for at least two cycles and the monitoring function is activated.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Output cycle counter monitoring is enabled and detected an error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check if the output cycle counter function is enabled in your NC. Check your EtherCAT realtime status.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Dynoutput cycle counter monitoring

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The dynoutput cycle counter of the controlword didn't increment for at least two cycles and the monitoring function is activated.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Output cycle counter monitoring is enabled and detected an error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check if the output cycle counter function is enabled in your NC. Check your EtherCAT realtime status.

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Axis needs an extended fault reset command

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The Axis received a fault reset command but needs an extended fault reset command

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Axis received a fault reset command but needs an extended fault reset command
CauseRemedy.Remedy: To leave the fault state try an extended fault reset command

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Illegal Modes Of Operation

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The modes of operation was set to an illegal value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The modes of operation was set to an illegal value.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the value of Object 0x6060 (Ch A) or Object 0x6860 (Ch B).

Detail.Name: Description

CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the write operations to Object 0x6060 (Ch A) or Object 0x6860 (Ch B).

Event.Message: Ch A, AxisMainSlot: Error reaction forced: Torque Off

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The error reaction "torque off" has been triggered and executed with the Object 0x3004 (Ch A) or Object 0x3404 (Ch B).

CauseRemedy.Cause: Standard reactions to errors can be tested with the Object 0x3004 (Ch A) or Object 0x3404 (Ch B). The resulting diagnostic message is exclusively a reminder that there is actually no error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: This diagnostic message requires no remedial action.

Event.Message: Ch A, PositionControlSlot: Following error

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The servo drive has detected a following error.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The following error has exceeded the maximum value.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and increase the maximum value of Object 6065 or 6066, if appropriate.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mechanical system is too sluggish.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and try make the mechanical system smoother.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error has occurred in the set value generation.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the cause (NC, internal set value generation, etc.). If no solution can be found, contact support.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The speed limit has been reached.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the motor parametrization or your calculation and check the maximum motor speed value used in the calculation.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The current limit has been reached.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the motor parametrization or your calculation and check whether the motor can theoretically follow the set values.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The set value dynamic characteristics are set too "hard".
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and check whether it is theoretically possible to achieve the specified dynamics.

Event.Message: Ch A, VelocityControlSlot: The bipolar velocity limit is higher than 1/4 of position range limit per EtherCAT Sync1 cycle.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The maximum accepted position step per cycle is 1/4 of the position range limit range. This error occurs, if the resulting velocity is lower than the bipolar velocity limit.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The maximum accepted position step per cycle is 1/4 of the position range limit range. This error occurs, if the resulting velocity is lower than the bipolar velocity limit.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Raise your position range limit or lower your bipolar velocity limit.

Event.Message: Ch A, VelocityControlSlot: Detected moving axis on enable transition.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The Axis was moving in the disabled State and was now stopped during the enable transition.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Axis was moving in the disabled State and was now stopped during the enable transition.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Enable Axis only, if it is not moving.

Event.Message: Ch A, VelocityControlSlot: Overspeed error

CauseRemedy.Cause: The speed of the axis is higher than the parameterized maximum value in the Velocity error tolerance Object
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Raise the velocity error tolerance or reduce your target velocity.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Short circuit (motor-side)

Detail.Text: The drive hardware detected an over-current on the motor phases. The short circuit detection was triggered.

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor cable.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor cable

CauseRemedy.Cause: Short circuit in the motor winding.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the motor winding with an high voltage test or check the winding resistance.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Phase failure motor

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The drive software detected an phase failure at the motor side. Please check wiring.

CauseRemedy.Cause: A power wire in the motor cable is broken.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the power wires in the motor cable.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The hybrid motor connector seems not to be plugged in properly.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check if the hybrid motor connector is plugged in properly.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: DC link under-voltage

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: An under-voltage occurred in the DC link circuit.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The DC link voltage level was under the configured minimum.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the minimum DC link voltage parameter. (Object 0x2C02/1)

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: DC link is not ready

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Axis got an enable command before DC link was ready.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check your power supply device.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Drive overtemperature shut down

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The drive temperature has reached a critical value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The ambient temperature is too high
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Cool down the ambient temperature

CauseRemedy.Cause: Internal brake power and power loss of axis are too high
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Lower the brake power and power loss of axis

CauseRemedy.Cause: The fan is defective
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the fan

CauseRemedy.Cause: The cooling slots or the measuring sensors are polluted
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Clean the cooling slots and the measuring sensors

CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check the status of the safety module.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Factor Group Parameters: Feed constant illegal feed

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The feed constant - feed contains an illegal value (Object 0x6092/1 ChA or 0x6892/1 ChB).
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please use a 2^{x} value (x from 16 to 28) for rotary encoders and a 10^{x} value (x from 0 to 9) for linear encoders.

Detail.Name: Description

CauseRemedy.Cause: The feed constant - shaft revolutions contains an illegal value (Object 0x6092/2 ChA or 0x6892/2 ChB).
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please set value to '1'.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Velocity factor illegal. A possible Value would be {0}/{1}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The velocity factor (Object 0x6096 ChA or 0x6896 ChB) does not adjust the velocity scaling to 0.1 mRPM in case of rotary Motors and 0.1 um/s in case of linear encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please change your setting to the suggested value.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Acceleration factor illegal. A possible Value would be {0}/{1}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The acceleration factor (Object 0x6097 ChA or 0x6897 ChB) does not adjust the velocity scaling to 1 degree/s^{2} in case of rotary Motors and 1 um/s^{2} in case of linear encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please change your setting to the suggested value.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Scaling index object 0x{0,x} does not fit the Factor group parameters for the first Encoder

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mentioned scaling index object doesn't represent the factor group settings of the first encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please compare the selected scaling to your factor group settings.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Scaling index object 0x{0,x} does not fit the Factor group parameters for the second Encoder

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mentioned scaling index object doesn't represent the factor group settings of the second encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please compare the selected scaling to your additional factor group settings.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Jerk factor illegal. A possible Value would be {0}/{1}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The actual combination of the factor group Parameters is not allowed for this Device.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The jerk factor (Object 0x60A2 ChA or 0x68A2 ChB) does not adjust the velocity scaling to 100 degree/s^{2} in case of rotary Motors and 100 um/s^{2} in case of linear encoder.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please change your setting to the suggested value.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: The range {0} of the Position range limit is below the minimum accepted value of {1}.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The range of the Position range limit (Object 0x6096 ChA or 0x6896 ChB) is below the minimum accepted value. The Range is calculated 'max limit' - 'min limit' + 1 and has to be positive.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The range of the Position range limit (Object 0x6096 ChA or 0x6896 ChB) is below the minimum accepted value. The Range is calculated 'max limit' - 'min limit' + 1 and has to be positive.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the min and max value of the position range limit.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Position range limit Inc with remainder is not supported for primary feedback.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The position range limit is scaled internally to encoder increments. This calculation result contains a remainder, which is not supported for the primary feedback.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The position range limit is scaled internally to encoder increments. This calculation result contains a remainder, which is not supported for the primary feedback.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the position range limit and the factor group parameters of this feedback.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Position range limit Inc with remainder is not supported for secondary feedback.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The position range limit is scaled internally to encoder increments. This calculation result contains a remainder, which is not supported for the secondary feedback.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The position range limit is scaled internally to encoder increments. This calculation result contains a remainder, which is not supported for the secondary feedback.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the position range limit and the factor group parameters of this feedback.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Object 0x{0,X}/{1,X} changed in EtherCAT SafeOP or OP.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: This errormessage was created, because this change during Runtime is potentially dangerous, if you don't know what you do.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The value of the position range limit or a Factor group object was changed in EtherCAT SafeOP or OP.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Execute fault reset command.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Motor brake: Current monitoring error.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The motor brake current monitoring detected an insufficient current.

CauseRemedy.Cause: You have configured a motor brake and the motor brake current fell below the motor brake current monitoring level.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check your motor brake connection (wires and connectors). Check the parameter 'motor brake current monitoring level' Object 0x3000/5 (Ch A) or Object 0x3400/5 (Ch B).

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Current sensor motor phase U

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: EtherCAT Statemachine shutdown with enabled Axis

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The EtherCAT Statemachine received a shutdown command, while the Axis was enabled.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The EtherCAT Statemachine received a shutdown command, while the Axis was enabled.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please disable your Axes before Restart or Shutdown your EtherCAT Master.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Controlword output cycle counter monitoring

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The output cycle counter of the controlword didn't increment for at least two cycles and the monitoring function is activated.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Output cycle counter monitoring is enabled and detected an error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check if the output cycle counter function is enabled in your NC. Check your EtherCAT realtime status.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Dynoutput cycle counter monitoring

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The dynoutput cycle counter of the controlword didn't increment for at least two cycles and the monitoring function is activated.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Output cycle counter monitoring is enabled and detected an error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Check if the output cycle counter function is enabled in your NC. Check your EtherCAT realtime status.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Axis needs an extended fault reset command

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The Axis received a fault reset command but needs an extended fault reset command

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Axis received a fault reset command but needs an extended fault reset command
CauseRemedy.Remedy: To leave the fault state try an extended fault reset command

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Illegal Modes Of Operation

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The modes of operation was set to an illegal value.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The modes of operation was set to an illegal value.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the value of Object 0x6060 (Ch A) or Object 0x6860 (Ch B).

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Illegal Modes Of Operation change

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The modes of operation was changed in an illegal transition while the axis was enabled.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The modes of operation was changed in an illegal transition while the axis was enabled.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please check the write operations to Object 0x6060 (Ch A) or Object 0x6860 (Ch B).

CauseRemedy.Cause: An object, which must be in the mapping is not mapped.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Please add a mapping to the mentioned object.

Event.Message: Ch B, AxisMainSlot: Error reaction forced: Torque Off

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The error reaction "torque off" has been triggered and executed with the Object 0x3004 (Ch A) or Object 0x3404 (Ch B).

CauseRemedy.Cause: Standard reactions to errors can be tested with the Object 0x3004 (Ch A) or Object 0x3404 (Ch B). The resulting diagnostic message is exclusively a reminder that there is actually no error.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: This diagnostic message requires no remedial action.

Event.Message: Ch B, PositionControlSlot: Following error

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The servo drive has detected a following error.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The following error has exceeded the maximum value.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and increase the maximum value of Object 6065 or 6066, if appropriate.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The mechanical system is too sluggish.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and try make the mechanical system smoother.

CauseRemedy.Cause: An error has occurred in the set value generation.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the cause (NC, internal set value generation, etc.). If no solution can be found, contact support.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The speed limit has been reached.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the motor parametrization or your calculation and check the maximum motor speed value used in the calculation.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The current limit has been reached.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze the motor parametrization or your calculation and check whether the motor can theoretically follow the set values.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The set value dynamic characteristics are set too "hard".
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Analyze your application and check whether it is theoretically possible to achieve the specified dynamics.

Event.Message: Ch B, VelocityControlSlot: The bipolar velocity limit is higher than 1/4 of position range limit per EtherCAT Sync1 cycle.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The maximum accepted position step per cycle is 1/4 of the position range limit range. This error occurs, if the resulting velocity is lower than the bipolar velocity limit.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The maximum accepted position step per cycle is 1/4 of the position range limit range. This error occurs, if the resulting velocity is lower than the bipolar velocity limit.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Raise your position range limit or lower your bipolar velocity limit.

Event.Message: Ch B, VelocityControlSlot: Detected moving axis on enable transition.

Detail.Name: Description
Detail.Text: The Axis was moving in the disabled State and was now stopped during the enable transition.

CauseRemedy.Cause: The Axis was moving in the disabled State and was now stopped during the enable transition.
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Enable Axis only, if it is not moving.

Event.Message: Ch B, VelocityControlSlot: Overspeed error

CauseRemedy.Cause: The speed of the axis is higher than the parameterized maximum value in the Velocity error tolerance Object
CauseRemedy.Remedy: Raise the velocity error tolerance or reduce your target velocity.
